messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]  Tricked!
messages.msgSnippet: As I was leaving the park one day (leaving because Jonathan had kicked another child) I stopped to talk with another parent (to apologize) I said, If I had
messages.messageBody:
As I was leaving the park one day (leaving because Jonathan had kicked
another child) I stopped to talk with another parent (to apologize) I said,
"If I had stopped raising kids after my daughter I could have boasted being
a perfect parent."

He got a good laugh out of that one.

Kris
----- Original Message -----
From: <kbcdlovejo@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, May 25, 2003 9:48 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tricked!


> In a message dated 5/25/2003 12:35:33 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
> AimeeL73@... writes:
>
>
> > << Cameron was *such* an easy child. I, too, thought that *I* was the
> > perfect
> > parent. Everyone else was just doing it WRONG!
> >
> > Then I had Duncan. <g>
> >
> > ~Kelly
> > >>
> > Oh, you were the victim of the Creators' master plan to birth as many
> > children as possible to unschooling parents!
> >
> > I always joke around that the birthing Goddess gave me Alex *first*, a
> > happy,
> > content, gorgeous child, to "trick" me into having more children.
>
> well, actually...no. There are eight years between my boys. Duncan is our
> surprise! <g>
>
> ~Kelly
